title: Add one-command export of the full project as a ZIP archive

requirements.text: Add a repository-level export command that packages the entire project source code (frontend + backend) into a downloadable ZIP archive, excluding build artifacts and dependency folders.

quotes: can you give me all codes files in zip

acceptanceCriteria: A single command is documented and available (e.g., via an npm script or shell script) that produces a .zip file containing the project source code.
The ZIP archive includes the backend and frontend source directories and any required configuration files needed to rebuild the project.
The ZIP archive excludes at minimum: node_modules/, .dfx/, dist/build output folders, and .git/ (if present).
The generated ZIP filename and output location are deterministic (same name and folder each time), and the command prints the output path on completion.

constraints: Keep all Motoko logic within the existing single-actor backend (backend/main.mo); do not introduce additional backend services.

Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx (these paths are immutable).
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Adding any new NGO ERP product features (dashboards, modules, reports, etc.).
Implementing any runtime in-app feature for end-users to download the code ZIP from the deployed application UI.
